intro: Schwenckia hirta var. adscendens, commonly known as the ascending hirta, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its erect, branching stems and showy, yellow flowers with a distinctive red calyx. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
